intro: Glandularia andina, commonly known as Andean glandularia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Glandularia andina is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some Andean cultures.
